studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 5.1 - Overall Study Design and Plan
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added provisions for virtual or alternative locations for study visits due to pandemic or state of emergency.
Modified joint assessments, pregnancy testing, and laboratory testing procedures to allow for local or home-based options.
Enabled Direct-to-Patient (DTP) shipment of study drug.
Added COVID-19 management guidance and updated ALT/AST interruption requirements.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To ensure subject safety and study continuity during the COVID-19 pandemic or other states of emergency.
Revised text to improve consistency and readability, and/or provide clarification.
Updated list of commonly used strong cytochrome 3A inducers.
Updated pregnancy and product complaint reporting timelines to 24 hours per sponsor requirements.

studyChanges.afterText: Direct-to Patient (DTP) and Coronavirus Disease â€“ 19 (COVID-19)
studyChanges.summary: Added new terms to the List of Abbreviations.

studyChanges.afterText: Subjects will have to discontinue study drug treatment immediately if they develop a gastrointestinal perforation with the exception of appendicitis or mechanical injury.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified discontinuation criteria for gastrointestinal perforation to align with Toxicity Management section.
Defined pregnancy reporting timeline according to sponsor requirements.

studyChanges.afterText: Starting with Amendment 5 all subjects will receive open-label upadacitinib 15 mg QD, including those currently on upadacitinib 30 mg QD.
studyChanges.summary: Updated methodology to reflect that all subjects transition to open-label 15 mg QD.

studyChanges.afterText: Optional Home Healthcare Service Due to State of Emergency or Pandemic Situation like COVID-19
studyChanges.summary: Added new section allowing home healthcare visits if site visits are not feasible.
